info.name: Siccar API Documentation
info.description:
## Siccar Version 3 API

This is the developer documentation for the Siccar V3 API. Specification, examples and basic tests as used by the core development team will be published here.

Services require a **Bearer** token in the Authorization header that has been created from the local installation Tenant server STS. It follows the Authorization Code With PKCE flow.

Some of our APIs are OData enabled for queries for a cheat sheet see: [https://skyvia.com/blog/odata-cheat-sheet](https://skyvia.com/blog/odata-cheat-sheet)

There are a some basic procedures required to setup up and use a register backed blueprint.

The following requests must be run to setup a Siccar installation.

1.  Create a tenant and add the identity provider the tenant will use.
2.  Get a bearer token by logging in using the newly created tenant identity provider
3.  Create a register.
4.  Update tenant adding the previously created register ID.
5.  Create a wallet.
    

After the above has been successfully completed, requests can be sent with your bearer token and you can use the created wallet for any wallet/transaction requests.

For more setup instructions please see:  
\[Create Register\]  
\[Create Wallets\]  
\[Publish Participants\]  
\[Create/Publish Blueprint\]  
\[Run Actions\]

item.name: Blueprint

request.description:
Publish a blueprint to the specified register. We sign the transaction with the specified wallet via the wallet address.

One of the following user roles is required:

*   blueprint.admin

Get all published blueprints for a given register. The wallet address is required for the request to be successful but for now blueprints are stored without encryption.

For now the assumption is that all blueprints are accessible to anyone who has access to the register the blueprint is stored on.

One of the following user roles is required:

*   blueprint.admin
*   blueprint.authoriser

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

item.description: Groups all requests that are for publishing or published blueprints. A published blueprint is one which is built into a transaction and stored on a register.

item.description: Groups all requests for handling draft blueprint requests. A draft blueprint is one which is stored in a separate data store. Changes can be made and once agreed it can be published to a register.

A **Blueprint** is a plan for *how participants share protected data.*

The purpose of a blueprint is to provide an AGREED pattern for *orchestrated business processes amongst participants, using trusted facts.*

One example of a blueprint in Public Services is the process of applying for a parking permit, ie:

*   applying for a parking permit,
*   validation of application details,
*   verification of entitlement and payment
    

*   and endorsement of permit,
*   evidenced by the permits chain of custody
    

A **blueprint** explicitly defines of:

*   **data** **items** (fields) and their **validation** rules, through JSON Schemas
*   **participants** via Wallet Addressing
*   **actions** which represents a steps
    *   data parameters, in and out - scoped to this action
    *   participants with data driven conditions and encryption management
    *   **disclosure** (permission) of data items for each step
    *   form - UI Generic render layout
*   **flow** using connecting steps into the overall blueprint
    

The Blueprint service manages the lifecycle of Blueprints, from Draft through agreement and publishing, with versioning and validation.

A Blueprint is a JSON Document :

Blueprint Actions and performed through the Action API

item.name: Action

request.description:
Gets all the first actions of any blueprints the authenticated user has access to.

One of the following user roles is required:

*   wallet.user

response.name: Success

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

request.description:
Our Actions are our outstanding transactions in the wallet.  
We will want to Query/Filter, Sort and only want summary data, not the payloads  
Use By ID to pull payloads so we dont decrypt to much data to early

StartFragment

One of the following user roles is required:

*   wallet.user
    

EndFragment

response.name: Success

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

                        "title": "Supplier Details",
                        "description": "Section that has all supplier details"
                    },

                        "title": "Name of Business",
                        "description": "The name of your business",
                        "default": "Drymuir Farm"
                    },
                    "storeLocation": {
                        "$id": "storeLocation",
                        "type": "string",
                        "title": "Store Location",
                        "description": "The location of your business",
                        "default": "Maud, Aberdeenshire"
                    },
                    "postcode": {
                        "$id": "postcode",
                        "type": "string",
                        "title": "Postcode",
                        "description": "The postcode of your business",
                        "default": "AB42 5RR"
                    },
                    "recipientDetails": {
                        "$id": "recipientDetails",
                        "type": "object",
                        "title": "Recipient Details",
                        "description": "Section that has all recipient details"
                    },
                    "recipientNameOfBusiness": {
                        "$id": "recipientNameOfBusiness",
                        "type": "string",
                        "title": "Name of Business",
                        "description": "The name of your business",
                        "default": "Jonathan Bell Grain Supplies"
                    },
                    "recipientStoreLocation": {
                        "$id": "recipientStoreLocation",
                        "type": "string",
                        "title": "Recipient Location",
                        "description": "The location of your business",
                        "default": "Dewsbury Road, Sheffield"
                    },
                    "recipientPostcode": {
                        "$id": "recipientPostcode",
                        "type": "string",
                        "title": "Postcode",
                        "description": "The postcode of your business",
                        "default": "S8 7PQ"
                    },
                    "recipientContact": {
                        "$id": "recipientContact",
                        "type": "string",
                        "title": "Contact Name",
                        "description": "",
                        "default": "F. Gordon"
                    },
                    "recipientPhone": {
                        "$id": "recipientPhone",
                        "type": "string",
                        "title": "Phone Number",
                        "description": "",
                        "default": "(0114) 584 4247"
                    },
                    "cropDetails": {
                        "$id": "cropDetails",
                        "type": "string",
                        "title": "Crop Details",
                        "description": "Your Crop Details."
                    },
                    "productType": {
                        "$id": "productType",
                        "title": "Product Type",
                        "description": "The type of product you're selling. Selecting Wheat will prompt a Fusarium Mycotoxin risk assessment. Selecting Oilseed, Linseed, Soyabean or Sunflower will prompt a GM declaration.",
                        "type": "string",
                        "enum": [
                            "Wheat",
                            "Barley",
                            "Oats",
                            "Rye",
                            "Maize",
                            "Triticale",
                            "Oilseed Rape",
                            "Linseed",
                            "Soya Bean",
                            "Sunflower Seed",
                            "Beans",
                            "Peas",
                            "Lupins"

                        "default": "Wheat"
                    },
                    "quantity": {
                        "$id": "quantity",
                        "type": "integer",

                        "default": 1
                    },
                    "haulierDetails": {
                        "$id": "haulierDetails",
                        "type": "object",
                        "title": "Haulier Details",
                        "description": "Section that has all haulier details"

                    "haulierCompany": {
                        "$id": "haulierCompany",

                    },
                    "haulierContact": {

                        "type": "string",

                        "description": "",
                        "default": "J Ferguson"
                    },

                        "type": "string",

                        "description": "",
                        "default": "(01639) 533847"
                    }
                }
            }
        ],
        "condition": {
            "if": [
                {
                    "==": [
                        {
                            "var": "productType"
                        },
                        "Wheat"
                    ]
                },
                2,
                {
                    "==": [
                        {
                            "var": "productType"
                        },
                        "Oilseed Rape"
                    ]
                },
                3,

                    "==": [

                        },
                        "Soya Bean"
                    ]
                },
                3,
                {
                    "==": [
                        {
                            "var": "productType"
                        },
                        "Sunflower Seed"
                    ]
                },
                3,
                {
                    "==": [
                        {
                            "var": "productType"
                        },
                        "Linseed"
                    ]
                },
                3,
                4
            ]
        },
        "form": {

request.description: This is being deprecated please see SubmitAction.

Submits the payload for an action.

The action is resolved based on the previous action transaction id and the blueprint id.

The wallet address is the desired wallet to encrypt and sign the payloads for the participants defined in the blueprint.

The register Id is the register to store the transactions in. This must be the same as the register the blueprint is stored in.

The data is the data required by the user to complete the action. It is a dictionary where the key is the name of the piece of data referenced in the action. The value is the data itself and needs to be of the correct type that is defined in the action schema.

StartFragment

One of the following user roles is required:

*   wallet.user
    

EndFragment

Submits the payload for an action.

The action is resolved based on the previous action transaction id and the blueprint id.

The wallet address is the desired wallet to encrypt and sign the payloads for the participants defined in the blueprint.

The register Id is the register to store the transactions in. This must be the same as the register the blueprint is stored in.

The data is the data required by the user to complete the action. It is a dictionary where the key is the name of the piece of data referenced in the action. The value is the data itself and needs to be of the correct type that is defined in the action schema.

StartFragment

One of the following user roles is required:

*   wallet.user
    

EndFragment

request.description:
Submits the payload for an action.

The action is resolved based on the previous action transaction id and the blueprint id.

The wallet address is the desired wallet to encrypt and sign the payloads for the participants defined in the blueprint.

The register Id is the register to store the transactions in. This must be the same as the register the blueprint is stored in.

The data is the data required by the user to complete the action. It is a dictionary where the key is the name of the piece of data referenced in the action. The value is the data itself and needs to be of the correct type that is defined in the action schema.

StartFragment

One of the following user roles is required:

*   wallet.user
    

EndFragment

item.description:
The action service goal is that a participant, within a blueprint, can perform and manage their interactions within a blueprint instance, and the data in its underlying register. This is participant focused in that it gives access to all registers and blueprint instances the participant is involved in.

A blueprint instance is created implicitly when a user submits the first action of a blueprint.

A secondary goal is that the user has access to interactive forms which render the data fields of each step. This is up to the client interacting with the action service. The SiccarSDK's dynamic form renderer can be used in any blazor project to achieve this.

The persona is an interactive or system user that maps to a participant, or a public user who can view public data fields

*   can find/start/cancel or go to a step of a running blueprint instances associated with a step for which they are the participant
*   Can see history of completed blueprint instances
*   Can view transaction history of blueprint instances
*   Interactive user can view and enter data into a form is rendered according to the data fields of that step (Delivered as a component from the SDK)
*   SDK Component can render Desktop and mobile
    

This should be extended to system scenarios

item.description:
Delegates are users within the Siccar Platform that have been "delegated" access to a wallet.

This access control is split into 3 types

delegaterw - Read/Write

delegatero - Read

owner - Read/Write

item.name: Creates a wallet and generates a master keyset

request.description:
Create a New Named Wallet

*   A friendly name must be provided
*   If a Mnemonic is provided the appropriate private key will be created
    

The Wallet will be created and a JSON Response provided which will include **only once** the recover Mnemonic.

The Wallet owner will be set to the current user identity

The Register Service will be informed of the new local Address.

item.name: Transactions

request.description:
Gets a transaction by id for the given wallet address. A call is made to the register service to get the transaction object.

One of the following user roles is required:

*   wallet.user

Creates a transaction which is then send to the validator service. The validator service will then add a reference to the transaction in a docket once consensus on the transactions has been completed.

The transaction will ultimately be stored on the specified register.

One of the following user roles is required:

*   wallet.user

Will attempt to decrypt any payloads the given wallet has available to it. Returns an array of byte arrays where each item in the top level is a separate payload.

The calling service will decode and deserialize the correct object type.

request.description:
Returns a list of pending transactions that the given wallet needs to take action on.

Pending transactions are previously submitted actions that the given wallet is the recipient of. It is the endpoint which powers the Get Actions endpoint on the Actions service.

item.description:
Handles all the transaction requests inside the Wallet Service.

The wallets are used to encrypt and sign the transactions.

A Wallet is a place where a participant holds cryptographic keys. The keys are used to perform cryptographic actions to maintain the security of data that is held with in an action 'transaction'.

A Wallet comprises:

*   A cryptographic key pair: one public the other private
*   An Address which is derived from the public key (think like an email inbox). A wallet can have many addresses (think aliases).
*   A set of properties, such as a friendly name
*   A list of delegates, users/systems who may be granted access to the wallet.
*   A list of transactions sent and received (like a bank account.
    

A Wallet is accessed by authenticated identities with granular authorisation context.

The Wallet links participants with a protectively stored set of Cryptographic keys. The wallet private keys are protected using the .Net Framework Data Protector configured best for the runtime infrastructure. Our Azure deployments use the Azure HSM Service for master key protection.

A participant uses the Wallet (with its keys) to perform functions upon the Register such as reading and sending cryptographic transactions.

The cryptography provides services such as signing, encrypting and decrypting data through transactions.

*   Signing: sealing data such that it can be proved that the data has not been modified and have come from a particular wallet / identity ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sealing_wax](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sealing_wax) )
    

*   Encrypting: using keys to encode plain text into cypher text such only a specified identity can read the contents ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Encryption](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Encryption) )
    

*   Decrypting: using keys to decode cypher text back into plain text
    

The Wallet is the only way to access keys and drive interaction between participants and Registers.

The Wallet listens for certain installation events in order to maintain the running state of the wallets i.e. maintaining transaction events

Wallet cryptographic functions such as Key Generation, Address derivation, hash routines and encryption are handled by the WalletService Crypto Library, which in turn uses libsodium-core ([https://github.com/ektrah/libsodium-core](https://desktop.postman.com/?desktopVersion=9.14.0&userId=3347452&teamId=0)).

item.description:
Register maintains a store of shared truths

A SICCAR **Register** is a distributed data store containing shared truths (We dont say ledger which implies financial transactions)

A Register is shared by a group of **Tenants** who collaborate securely, (noting that a P**articipant** is an external identity which can interact with multiple tenants.)

A Register is maintained across multiple **installations** - actual replication is performed by the **Peer** Service

We say shared truths because

*   they are a common set of facts which have been agreed by **Tenants**
*   validated using a decentralised mechanism
*   which are subject to rules for data **flow** (from participant to participant) , validation, and protection as defined in a **Blueprint**
    

Once committed a shared truth cant be changed,

A shared truth can be evidenced by a chain of custody of assured data defined by data **Flow** and the embedded transaction history.

The Register is:

*   a description of its properties (register name, docket height)
*   transactions which contain secured data.
*   transactions are validated and verified by a mechanism called **consensus** which is run by **tenants** hosting that register
    

*   validated transactions are batched and secured in a structure within the register that we call a *Docket.*
    

*(We say docket instead of block to distinguish that we do not store all the transactional data in the block, but instead a reference to the external transaction, docket means summary of contents by the way)*

There are different types of transactions that can be published to the Register

*   Blueprints
*   Action Data (payload)
*   Participant details
    

Transactions have both public (i.e., public to the subscribed group of tenants) and **protected** data, the public part include the tracking metadata if so required. The payload data is encrypted for the participants using the Wallet Crypto Library, which in turn uses libsodium-core ([https://github.com/ektrah/libsodium-core](https://github.com/ektrah/libsodium-core)).

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

item.description:
A **Tenant** is an organisation (e.g., a company, division, or another entity that is a legal or administrative entity)

A Tenant comprises of external participants or identities (including users, teams/groups of users, and system accounts) that use the SICCAR installation. An installation may have multiple tenants therefore the Tenant Service will manage on behalf of all tenants who are on that installation.

item.name: Participants

body.raw:
{
    "walletAddress" :"ws1jw3s4964su9aqgqfxh5c8gwrzuvx74h92gmpq5wln6334kzw2f0cq384wsj",

    "organisation": "Test Organisation A",
    "didUri": null,
    "useStealthAddress" : false
}

request.description:
This method allows an organisational administrator to publish publishes a **Participant** record to the given Register.

The participant record is provided in the body

``` json
{
    "walletAddress" :"{{walletAddress}}",
    "name" : "Default Test Address",
    "organisation": "Test Organisation A",
    "didUri": null,
    "useStealthAddress" : false
}

```

By default the transaction will be signed with the default wallet of the administrative user performing this action. This can be over ridded by providing an additional Address that the executing user has Read/Write access to and this will be use to sign the transaction.

One of the following user roles is required:

*   blueprint.admin
*   tenant.admin

``` json
}

```

By default the transaction will be signed with the default wallet of the administrative user performing this action. This can be over ridded by providing an additional Address that the executing user has Read/Write access to and this will be use to sign the transaction.

One of the following user roles is required:

*   blueprint.admin
*   tenant.admin

item.description:
A Participant is an object a user of a Tenant can create to be used within a Blueprint.

The Participant object stored the wallet address that will be used to get pending actions and do encryption/signing.

Users of a Tenant will be given access to a Participant so they may execute/submit actions using the underlying wallet.

request.description:
This is a *ONE TIME* Api that can be used on a clean installation to install an initial tenant configuration.

The contents of the post body should define at least 1 Tenant and 1 Client,

*   the Tenant ID will be generated by the system
*   clients will be linked to the parent tenant
    

For format of submission see example

Any subsequent calls will result in a 401 - Not Found

Any errors in the process will be reported.

Use this endpoint to manually get an access token. Tokens can be generated automatically using Postman Authorization for OAuth2 and supplying the correct credentials.

You will need to run the Request Auth Code endpoint first to get an authorization code. You will need to paste in the code verifier string and the returned code into this request.

You can use this endpoint to manually get an authorization code for use with the token endpoint.

Use [https://example-app.com/pkce](https://example-app.com/pkce) to generate a code verifier(for use within the token endpoint) and a code_challenge.

Copy the code challenge into the this requests. Use the correct base url for your Siccar installation. Copy and paste the request into the browser. Login using your IDP. You you will be redirected to a blank page. Copy the code from the response url. This will be used for the token endpoint.

item.description:
The following roles can be assigned to users:

*   blueprint.admin
*   installation.admin
*   installation.reader
*   installation.billing
*   register.creator
*   register.maintainer
*   register.reader
*   tenant.billing
*   tenant.admin
*   tenant.app.admin
*   wallet.user

A **Tenant** is an organisation (e.g., a company, division, or another legal or administrative entity)

The term Tenant is used because it has more meaning in our context.

A Tenant comprises external **participants** or identities (including users, teams/groups of users, and system accounts) that use the SICCAR installation. An installation may have multiple tenants therefore the **Tenant Service** will manage on behalf of all tenants who are on that installation.

The Tenant service is responsible for all Authorisation of administrative actions on this installation. Examples of these actions are (grant or deny):

*   Access to services to maintain the SICCAR installation
*   A participant (identity) (i.e., individual, team or system) may have access to one or more wallets
    

*   Conversely A Wallet may be accessed by one or more participant/identity (individual, team or system).
*   Granular access control to e.g., particular registers
*   The rights to
    *   creation of wallets
    *   Delegation of wallets (granting access to somebody else)
    *   Publishing of blueprint (and associated actions)
    *   Publishing of a blueprints participants details (name, public key) to a register

The Tenant Service provides Bearer Access Tokens for service access once an OIDC login has been completed with the relevant Identity Provider.

Currently tested:

*   Azure Active Directory
*   Azure B2C
*   IdentityServer4 Generic OIDC Service
    

Access Token payload :

> `{ "nbf": 1647343132,`

> `"exp": 1647346732,`

> `"iss": "https://localhost:8443",`

> `"aud": "wallet",`

> `"client_id": "siccar-client",`

> `"sub": "9de0598c-2e79-464a-94f3-a6b4610a3946",`

> `"auth_time": 1647343131,`

> `"idp": "SiccarNetServer",`

> `"Tenant": "SiccarNetServer",`

> `"Registers": "40daacacf4ef407cb5c4b9b7d0e7fe36",`

> `"jti": "D21397C279053965C8A3EC8C4938746B",`

> `"sid": "3C07BF73F645F91FC70AA0F77167C3CD",`

> `"iat": 1647343132,`

> `"scope": [ "wallet_admin" ],`

> `"amr": [ "external" ]`

> `}`
